*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Dubai Mall store

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Al Quoz warehouse location

*         Invoice for electrical repairs works at Al Quoz studio location in the sum of AED 2,000 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for mitigation works AED 6,630 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Al Quoz for AED 1,022.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Dubai mall for AED 1,895.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for redecoration works in Dubai Mall for AED 39,237.50

 

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

 

*	We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. We have reviewed the spreadsheet provided by the Insured. We note that the Insured had populated the rates and item names against the bar codes. However, the location of the items was not indicated. Can the Insured please add the location of the stock at the time of loss for our reference. 

 

*	A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap. - We await for the purchase invoice copies. 

 

*	We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands. - We would require the Insured to either sell the shoes for a reduced price or obtain a minimum of three competitive salvage offers for the affected stock item for our further assessment. 

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached, - Received.

Attached, - Received.

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached - We note that total stock items shared included merely 320 number of shoes. It appears that the total stock list for the Dubai Mall to be incomplete. Please provide the total inventory list available at Dubai Mall Location. 

 

*	We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. - We await presentation of this information. 

 

*	The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. We await for the presentation of a minimum three salvage offers or these item need to be sold on a reduced price.

 

*	Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. Attached in previous mail along with method statement and competitive quote. Competitive quotes not received, please resubmit for our review. 

 

*	We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations. Attached excluding dome repair, which is pending. Invoices presented are indicated above and proof of payment awaited. 

 

Upon receipt of this information, we will confirm additional information that may be required to agree the way forward.

Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

chunks.text:
*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Dubai mall for AED 1,895.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for redecoration works in Dubai Mall for AED 39,237.50

 

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

 

*	We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item.

chunks.text:
Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. We have reviewed the spreadsheet provided by the Insured. We note that the Insured had populated the rates and item names against the bar codes. However, the location of the items was not indicated. Can the Insured please add the location of the stock at the time of loss for our reference. 

 

*	A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap. - We await for the purchase invoice copies. 

 

*	We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands. - We would require the Insured to either sell the shoes for a reduced price or obtain a minimum of three competitive salvage offers for the affected stock item for our further assessment. 

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached, - Received.

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached - We note that total stock items shared included merely 320 number of shoes. It appears that the total stock list for the Dubai Mall to be incomplete. Please provide the total inventory list available at Dubai Mall Location. 

 

*	We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise.

@Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. - We await presentation of this information. 

 

*	The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. We await for the presentation of a minimum three salvage offers or these item need to be sold on a reduced price.

 

*	Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. Attached in previous mail along with method statement and competitive quote. Competitive quotes not received, please resubmit for our review. 

 

*	We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations. Attached excluding dome repair, which is pending. Invoices presented are indicated above and proof of payment awaited. 

 

Upon receipt of this information, we will confirm additional information that may be required to agree the way forward.

Accordingly review the above and provide the pending information.

 

Thanking you.

Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC - Rain Damage - Level Shoes Al Quoz MFC - DOL: 16/04/2024 - Insurer: GIG / 13/FA/33913/0/41 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-05-000217

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached 

 

*         We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. 

 

*         The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise.

Please feel free to reach out should you require clarity.

 

Regards

Sujith

Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

Dear Sujith,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the loss adjuster finding as below:

 

Quote

*         A copy of incident report from mall owners

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Dubai Mall store

chunks.text:
*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Dubai Mall store

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Al Quoz warehouse location

*         Invoice for electrical repairs works at Al Quoz studio location in the sum of AED 2,000 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for mitigation works AED 6,630 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Al Quoz for AED 1,022.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Dubai mall for AED 1,895.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for redecoration works in Dubai Mall for AED 39,237.50

 

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

chunks.text:
Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

 

*	We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. We have reviewed the spreadsheet provided by the Insured. We note that the Insured had populated the rates and item names against the bar codes. However, the location of the items was not indicated. Can the Insured please add the location of the stock at the time of loss for our reference. 

 

*	A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap. - We await for the purchase invoice copies. 

 

*	We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands. - We would require the Insured to either sell the shoes for a reduced price or obtain a minimum of three competitive salvage offers for the affected stock item for our further assessment. 

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached, - Received.

chunks.text:
Attached, - Received.

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached - We note that total stock items shared included merely 320 number of shoes. It appears that the total stock list for the Dubai Mall to be incomplete. Please provide the total inventory list available at Dubai Mall Location. 

 

*	We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. - We await presentation of this information. 

 

*	The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. We await for the presentation of a minimum three salvage offers or these item need to be sold on a reduced price.

 

*	Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. Attached in previous mail along with method statement and competitive quote. Competitive quotes not received, please resubmit for our review. 

 

*	We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations. Attached excluding dome repair, which is pending. Invoices presented are indicated above and proof of payment awaited. 

 

Upon receipt of this information, we will confirm additional information that may be required to agree the way forward.

Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Dubai Mall store

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Al Quoz warehouse location

*         Invoice for electrical repairs works at Al Quoz studio location in the sum of AED 2,000 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for mitigation works AED 6,630 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Al Quoz for AED 1,022.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Dubai mall for AED 1,895.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for redecoration works in Dubai Mall for AED 39,237.50

 

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

 

*	We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. We have reviewed the spreadsheet provided by the Insured. We note that the Insured had populated the rates and item names against the bar codes. However, the location of the items was not indicated. Can the Insured please add the location of the stock at the time of loss for our reference. 

 

*	A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap. - We await for the purchase invoice copies. 

 

*	We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands. - We would require the Insured to either sell the shoes for a reduced price or obtain a minimum of three competitive salvage offers for the affected stock item for our further assessment. 

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached, - Received.

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached - We note that total stock items shared included merely 320 number of shoes. It appears that the total stock list for the Dubai Mall to be incomplete. Please provide the total inventory list available at Dubai Mall Location. 

 

*	We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. - We await presentation of this information. 

 

*	The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. We await for the presentation of a minimum three salvage offers or these item need to be sold on a reduced price.

 

*	Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. Attached in previous mail along with method statement and competitive quote. Competitive quotes not received, please resubmit for our review. 

 

*	We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations. Attached excluding dome repair, which is pending. Invoices presented are indicated above and proof of payment awaited. 

 

Upon receipt of this information, we will confirm additional information that may be required to agree the way forward.

Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil 

Assistant Claims Manager - General Insurance

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Dubai Mall store

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Al Quoz warehouse location

*         Invoice for electrical repairs works at Al Quoz studio location in the sum of AED 2,000 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for mitigation works AED 6,630 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Al Quoz for AED 1,022.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Dubai mall for AED 1,895.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for redecoration works in Dubai Mall for AED 39,237.50

 

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

 

*	We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. We have reviewed the spreadsheet provided by the Insured. We note that the Insured had populated the rates and item names against the bar codes. However, the location of the items was not indicated. Can the Insured please add the location of the stock at the time of loss for our reference. 

 

*	A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap. - We await for the purchase invoice copies. 

 

*	We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands. - We would require the Insured to either sell the shoes for a reduced price or obtain a minimum of three competitive salvage offers for the affected stock item for our further assessment. 

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached, - Received.

Attached, - Received.

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached - We note that total stock items shared included merely 320 number of shoes. It appears that the total stock list for the Dubai Mall to be incomplete. Please provide the total inventory list available at Dubai Mall Location. 

 

*	We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. - We await presentation of this information. 

 

*	The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. We await for the presentation of a minimum three salvage offers or these item need to be sold on a reduced price.

 

*	Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. Attached in previous mail along with method statement and competitive quote. Competitive quotes not received, please resubmit for our review. 

 

*	We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations. Attached excluding dome repair, which is pending. Invoices presented are indicated above and proof of payment awaited. 

 

Upon receipt of this information, we will confirm additional information that may be required to agree the way forward.

Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Dubai Mall store

*         Tenancy contract registration certificate for Al Quoz warehouse location

*         Invoice for electrical repairs works at Al Quoz studio location in the sum of AED 2,000 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for mitigation works AED 6,630 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Al Quoz for AED 1,022.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for electrical repairs at Dubai mall for AED 1,895.00 (excl. VAT)

*         Invoice copy for redecoration works in Dubai Mall for AED 39,237.50

 

In addition to the above, we understand that the rainwater entered the premises as a result of the following; Please correct if our understanding is wrong: 

 

*	Dubail Mall location: The failed stormwater pipes led to rainwater escaping into the store premises. We understand that these stormwater pipes are owned, installed, and maintained by the mall owner. 

 

*	Al Quoz MFC: The premises experienced rainwater penetration due to failed roof sheet joints. We believe that the roof sheets of the warehouse are installed and maintained by the landlord. 

We note that the following comments have been made by the Insured and we add our responses along with any additional requirement in blue:

 

*	A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rainwater entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets. Noted. 

 

*	A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. Noted. Please provide the detailed tenancy contract with all wordings for both locations.

 

*	We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. We have reviewed the spreadsheet provided by the Insured. We note that the Insured had populated the rates and item names against the bar codes. However, the location of the items was not indicated. Can the Insured please add the location of the stock at the time of loss for our reference. 

 

*	A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap. - We await for the purchase invoice copies. 

 

*	We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands. - We would require the Insured to either sell the shoes for a reduced price or obtain a minimum of three competitive salvage offers for the affected stock item for our further assessment. 

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached, - Received.

Attached, - Received.

 

*	A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss. Attached - We note that total stock items shared included merely 320 number of shoes. It appears that the total stock list for the Dubai Mall to be incomplete. Please provide the total inventory list available at Dubai Mall Location. 

 

*	We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location. @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. - We await presentation of this information. 

 

*	The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. Stock is stored at Al Qouz MFC. Brands we deal with do not allow salvaging / bulk sale activities @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to advise. We await for the presentation of a minimum three salvage offers or these item need to be sold on a reduced price.

 

*	Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. Attached in previous mail along with method statement and competitive quote. Competitive quotes not received, please resubmit for our review. 

 

*	We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations. Attached excluding dome repair, which is pending. Invoices presented are indicated above and proof of payment awaited. 

 

Upon receipt of this information, we will confirm additional information that may be required to agree the way forward.

Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

metadata.doc_id: CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CYRZ0N4 - insured allied enterprises llc - rain damage - level shoes al quoz mfc -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. 

 

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

 

Unquote

 

We wait for the above at your earliest.

 

Thanking you.

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil
