Dear Hani, 

 

Hope you are well. 

Please see below comments and relevant attachments.  Please note that stock purchase invoices is pending, we are working on this and shall be shared by early next week.

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations. – Attached copy of TDM incident report relevant to level shoes Dubai Mall. Leakage pertaining to MFC is Rain water entering through the roofing sheet joints at specific locations due to continuous and heavy rain damaging the stock and assets.

 

*         A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations. Attached Ejari for both locations. 

 

*         We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review. Please mention the serial number of locations against each stock item. Attached. 

 

*         A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. Pending, shall be shared asap.

 

*         We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. New packaging provision is not available with brands.

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. Attached,

 

*         A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

chunks.text:
Please refer to the loss adjuster finding as per below and share the requested details.

 

Quote

 

The matter at hand relates damage sustained to the Insured’s stock and interior decoration at two different locations on the date in question. 

 

Al Quoz Warehouse:

 

During the course of our inspection, we were advised that at Al Quoz location, the rainwater entered from the defective roof joints and defective fiber roof sheets. The rainwater was advised to be pouring on the high stock racks resulting in damage to the packaging of the stock items. We carried out validation of damaged inventory and bar codes of the affected stock items are in the attached spreadsheet. 

 

Studio electrical repairs: We were advised that the electrical components in distribution panel of studio were damaged due to rainwater entry. The affected components were already replaced to restore power supply. We have been provided with a quotation of AED 2,000.

 

Electrical lights: We were advised that ceiling lights were damaged in the office room due to rainwater ingress from the roof. We were advised that the damaged lights had already been replaced by the Insured and we have now been provided with a quotation in the sum of AED 1,022.

 

We observed that the stock damage at the Dubai mall location was as well transferred to the Al Quoz warehouse location. We carried out our assessment as per the stock available in the store and collected all the bar codes of the items which are populated in the attached sheets. We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately.

We identified that there were existing damaged items and bar codes which are indicated separately. 

 

Dubai Mall: 

 

We visited the Dubail mall location to inspect the damage sustained to the interior decoration and electrical installations. We observed that all the repairs were completed except for the dome light fabric cleaning / replacement. We have been provided by a single quotation for the repairs of the interior decoration inside the Dubai mall in the sum of AED 39,237.50, which is duly noted. 

 

Electrical lights : We have been provided with a single quotation for replacement of the affected ceiling lights in the sum of AED 1,895. However, we observed that the lights have been already replaced for continuation of store operation. 

 

Dome light repairs: The Insured provide us with a single quotation for replacement of the dome light fabric in the sum of AED 10,500. We advised the Insured obtain competitive quotations from the market the presented costs appeared to be very high compared to the scope of work involved.

 

Mitigation work: The Insured presented an invoice for immediate mitigation work to avoid further damage to the stock in the sum of AED 4,680, which is duly noted. 

 

Noting all the above, we would now request the Insured to provide us with the following information for our further assessment: 

 

A confirmation as to how the rainwater entered the premises at both affected locations.

 

A copy of tenancy contract for both affected locations.

 

We have attached the inspected bar code sheet; we would request the Insured to populate the other information including costs for our review.

A copy of supporting purchase invoice copies for the stock damaged. 

 

We would suggest the Insured that any stock item capable of reselling merely by replacing with the new boxes would be much appreciated and we can consider such new repackaging costs if economical. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the warehouse as on the date of loss. 

 

A copy full priced inventory of both damaged and undamaged stock at the Dubai Mall location as on the date of loss.

 

We note that the Policy schedule includes 146 locations. We would request the Insured to identify and share the affected location.

 

The affected stock should be securely stored in a safe location and a minimum of three competitive salvage offers should be obtained. 

 

Please provide competitive quotations for affected dome light fabric replacement. 

 

We would require final invoice documentation and proof of payment for the repairs completed at both locations.

 

We would now await for the above requested information and following review of which we shall advices further in this subject matter.

 

Looking forward for receipt of the above requested information.

We wait for the above at your earliest.
